subtitles_text: >> JEFF PROBST: The South
Pacific.Thousands of islands
lay scattered across the world'smost beautiful ocean.
But for centuries, man hastraveled these waters to meet
in combat.From brutal tribal warfare to
the the epic battles of WorldWar II, this is a place where
rivals have long traveled tosettle old scores.
It is the perfect setting forour biggest showdown yet.
Welcome to the 20th season ofSurvivor.
Over the past ten years,Survivor has traveled to some
of the most desolate,dangerous and exotic places
in the world.(bird calling)
Over 300 people have testedthemselves in the most
difficult and groundbreakingshow on television.
We have gathered 20 of them toplay one more time.
These are ten of your favoriteheroes...
versus ten of the mostnotorious villains.
>> In my world, I've alwaystried to show that good
will win.>> I'm a villain.
I think villains are smarterthan heroes because they don't
mind stabbing somebody in theback to get where they want
to get.It's a fact.
It's a proven fact.Google it.
>> The Heroes are definitelypeople I would rather play the
game with.The Villains are the people
I've always been against.So this is perfect for me to be
on the heroes' side and battleit out against these punks I
don't like anyway.>> I've been labeled things
like "She-devil in a bluebikini," "The wicked witch of
the West.""Man-eater Manthey"-- that was
my favorite one.(chuckles)
>> I'm back here to do what Icame to do the first time-- get
to the end and make the money.So I'm definitely coming back
to redeem myself.>> This time, I slay everyone
and trust no one.This is my chance for
redemption.>> I'm not in the shape I was
last time, but I still thinkthat I could hang in there as
tough as any guy next to me.>> But these people are
smart, they'll get rid of meright right away.
It's the smartest thing theycould do, but they won't.
They never do.>> I'm almost a decade older
than I was the first time.So to me, it's a test to see if
I still got it.>> Last time I was mean, and
this time I'm meaner.You know, I'll lie.
I don't care.But I'll make up a good lie.
>> People think they know me.They really don't know me.
(laughing)I'm a gangster in a Oprah suit.
But I'm not, like,a mean gangster.
I'm a nice gangster with asmile, you know.
>> PROBST: it is still theultimate challenge:
20 people forced to worktogether while battling the
elements and each other.They must learn to adapt or
they'll be voted out.In the end, only one will
remain to claim themillion-dollar prize.
39 days, 20 people,one survivor.
(theme song playing)♪ ♪
>> Flying in the choppers, myheart's beating a mile a minute.
I'm sitting right next to Tomand Cirie and all these people.
I know the game's going.I'm finally back in the game.

in the air.There's an electricity.
There's a tension.There's a level of excitement
that is coursing througheverybody's veins,
especially mine.And to start off like that, I
think sets a great tone for howthe season is gonna be.

get my mind straight and notlet them get me too starstruck.
I'm out here playing a gamewith them now.

bungee jump or something, youget that knot in your stomach,
and it, like, makes you want tothrow up, kind of?
That's how I feel right now.>> I look over and see my
fellow tribemates with the bluebuff on getting out of their
copter and running over.It's pretty intense, you know?
My tribe, the Heroes tribe,they're hard-working, you know,
tough guys, good people.I was like, you know,
"This is it."I can't wait to kick some
ass out here.♪ ♪
